{"step_by_step_thinking": "Intrafusal muscle fibers are part of the muscle spindle and are involved in detecting the amount and rate of change in length of a muscle. According to Document [10], both ends of these fibers contract, but the central region only stretches and does not contract. This is because the central region has little contractile protein. Therefore, the contractile parts of the intrafusal fibers are the ends.", "answer_choice": "B"}
